{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2952397,"name":null,"username":"InterstellarDrift","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/e95f7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-05-06T15:15:28.917Z","cooked":"

Our team recently acquired some MK3 swerve modules, but we have not been able to get them to work properly. The problem that we are currently trying to solve in order to get our swerve working is the fact that the CanCoders are not correctly linking to the TalonFX motor controllers as remote sensors. We isolated this issue from the rest of the codebase and attempted to set up a CanCoder as a remote sensor for its respective talon in a fresh codebase.

Here is a link to the GitHub repo hosting the code we are using to test this: link to repo

Any assistance in resolving this issue would be greatly appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2021-05-06T15:15:28.917Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":406,"reads":213,"readers_count":212,"score":2102.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":393943,"topic_slug":"cancoder-is-not-connecting-to-our-talonfx-as-a-remote-sensor-properly","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/InterstellarDrift/tuneFX","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - InterstellarDrift/tuneFX","clicks":38}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49025,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/cancoder-is-not-connecting-to-our-talonfx-as-a-remote-sensor-properly/393943/1","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2952413,"name":"Jacob Caporuscio","username":"Jacob_C","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/97f17d/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-05-06T16:13:10.858Z","cooked":"

What’s the actual issue you’re observing?

I understand you’re trying to use a CANcoder as a remote sensor, but what behavior are you seeing that’s not as expected? What does the self-test snapshot of the Talon FX look like after being configured?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2021-05-06T16:13:10.858Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":60.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":393943,"topic_slug":"cancoder-is-not-connecting-to-our-talonfx-as-a-remote-sensor-properly","display_username":"Jacob Caporuscio","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12889,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Engineer at CTR Electronics"},"post_url":"/t/cancoder-is-not-connecting-to-our-talonfx-as-a-remote-sensor-properly/393943/2","custom_user_title":"Engineer at CTR Electronics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2952417,"name":null,"username":"InterstellarDrift","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/e95f7d/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-05-06T16:31:48.260Z","cooked":"

We were trying simply to move the MK3 module to a specific position, but it was not moving. We tried to set the encoder as the remote sensor of the default PID loop, which should be PID0, but when we would refresh the self-test snapshot after manually rotating the module, the PID0 encoder still read as 0. Is our code not setting the CanCoder as a remote sensor correctly, or are we not telling the TalonFX to go to a specific rotation correctly? I can get you some screenshots of the self-test snapshot later in the afternoon at around 4:00 when our team meeting starts if you would like. Sorry about the lack of detail in the original post.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2021-05-06T16:32:19.841Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":189,"readers_count":188,"score":57.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":393943,"topic_slug":"cancoder-is-not-connecting-to-our-talonfx-as-a-remote-sensor-properly","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49025,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/cancoder-is-not-connecting-to-our-talonfx-as-a-remote-sensor-properly/393943/3","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2952418,"name":"Jacob Caporuscio","username":"Jacob_C","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/97f17d/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-05-06T16:36:57.123Z","cooked":"

Yes, a screenshot or copy-paste of the snapshot contents will help diagnose the issue.

Make sure you follow this section of the bring-up to validate the remote sensor configuration:

docs.ctre-phoenix.com

Bring Up: Remote Sensors

This section provides direction for configuring and validating remote sensor setups. The remote sensor filter feature of the Talon SRX/Victor SPX allows for the processing of sensor values provided...

As a general step, also triple-check that you’ve update both Talon and CANcoder device firmware and the IDs are set correctly.

Thanks for the quick response! I’ll double check the IDs, the firmware versions, and the self-test snapshot settings at our team meeting this afternoon.

Sorry, I put that in so many messages, but as I only recently created my Chief Delphi account to post this topic, it is only letting me insert one attachment per post, and so I had to split up the message.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2021-05-06T22:39:58.331Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":129,"readers_count":128,"score":125.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":393943,"topic_slug":"cancoder-is-not-connecting-to-our-talonfx-as-a-remote-sensor-properly","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49025,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming"},"post_url":"/t/cancoder-is-not-connecting-to-our-talonfx-as-a-remote-sensor-properly/393943/12","custom_user_title":"Programming","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2952529,"name":"Jacob Caporuscio","username":"Jacob_C","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/97f17d/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-05-06T23:53:01.129Z","cooked":"

2 items:

  • The remote filter 0 source config is incorrect on the Talon FX. It’s currently set to ‘RemoteTalon_SelectedSensor’ when it should be Remote CANcoder.

  • Keep in mind that while CANcoder reports degrees, the CANcoder measurement reported to the FX is not in degrees - it will be in the units specified here:
    Bring Up: Talon FX/SRX Sensors — Phoenix documentation
    So the measurement in CANcoder’s self-test will be in degrees, the PID0 position in FX’s self-test will be in the rotation units from the linked table.

Wait, WHAT? I’ve lost hours to trying to debug this. groan

Sure enough, here’s the warning:

Screen Shot 2021-09-05 at 11.47.45 AM1658×276 35.1 KB

And here are the details:

docs.ctre-phoenix.com

Errata

CANCoder vH configs don’t show up in Tuner: CANCoder vH configs do not show up on the Config Tab in Phoenix Tuner with API versions 5.21.2 and older. This does not affect the original CANCoder. For...

CanIDs are getting truncated to Id % 16 (they say %15 in the article, but if the can id is <=15 then isn’t it mod 16? or is zero excluded? whatever.)

@ozrien @Jacob_C is there a better way to surface this error? Something that might get printed to the console.

This is what I get for trying to be clever with assigning CAN ids. I was grouping the CAN Ids so that they were 1,11,21 for left front, 2, 12, 22 for right front, etc… single digits for drive, teens for angle control, and 20s for CANcoders.
